column5: Do it now... weather it's your spouse, your kids, siblings, parents, or pets!  Say it when you can, you never know what might happen! Last night my mother in law passed on, she had been in the hospital for some minor surgery, ended up going into Cardiac Arrest early this morning, she slipped away around 8am. I know I told my mom when I broke the news to her this morning.  Mark

Condolences to the family Wendel/Mark. Something you'd never expect with "minor" surgery.  I know the drill all tooo well, unfortunately. My older sister and brother just left... after 3 days of sorting/dividing my kid sister's stuff and going through all of Mother's pictures and picking what we wanted.  Wayne

Dang Mark sorry to here that sorry for your guys loss some times I think my kids get tired of me telling them how much I love them but one day they will understand how much I really do love them the wife just thinks I am trying to get out fishing again.
Same here. They probably won't get it until they are parents, but that's okay. I too am sorry to hear of your loss. Jim
very sorry to hear this mark.  my thoughts go out to you and your family in this tough time.  jason
Sorry to hear, Mark. Thanks for the reminder. Chris
So sorry to hear of your loss Mark.  Please accept my sincerest condolences. Leechman
every day.  sorry for your loss.

Sorry for your loss Mark You are right we should tell them we love them. A good friend of mine buried his 42 yr old wife today. 3 weeks after finding out she had cancer. Tell your loved ones you love them every chance you get. Again my condolences  Rick

Sorry for your loss, every time the phone rings we jump as my mother-in-law is in the same boat, any day, just this morning at 7:30 my wife got the call that they could not wak her up, they did but just nerve racking.  Good luck, our thoughts and prayers go out to you and your family.  FLEX
